description: Create Amazon Web Services service usage that you want to model in a Workload Estimate.

parameters.name: workloadEstimateId
parameters.description: The ID of the Workload estimate for which you want to create the modeled usage.

parameters.name: usage
parameters.description: List of usage that you want to model in the Workload estimate. (dict) --- Represents an entry in a batch operation to create workload estimate usage. The Amazon Web Services service code for this usage estimate. The type of usage being estimated. The specific operation associated with this usage estimate. A unique identifier for this entry in the batch operation. group (string) --- An optional group identifier for the usage estimate. The Amazon Web Services account ID associated with this usage estimate. The estimated usage amount. historicalUsage (dict) --- Historical usage data associated with this estimate, if available. The Amazon Web Services service code associated with the usage. The type of usage. The specific operation associated with the usage. location (string) --- The location associated with the usage. The Amazon Web Services account ID associated with the usage. The time interval for the historical usage data. start (datetime) --- The start date and time of the interval. end (datetime) --- The end date and time of the interval. An optional filter expression to apply to the historical usage data. and (list) --- A list of expressions to be combined with AND logic. (dict) --- Represents a complex filtering expression for cost and usage data. or (list) --- A list of expressions to be combined with OR logic. not (dict) --- An expression to be negated. costCategories (dict) --- Filters based on cost categories. key (string) --- The key or attribute to filter on. matchOptions (list) --- The match options for the filter (e.g., equals, contains). (string) --- values (list) --- The values to match against. (string) --- dimensions (dict) --- Filters based on dimensions (e.g., service, operation). (string) --- tags (dict) --- Filters based on resource tags. (string) ---

nested_params.name: serviceCode
nested_params.description: The Amazon Web Services service code for this usage estimate.

nested_params.name: usageType
nested_params.description: The type of usage being estimated.

nested_params.name: operation
nested_params.description: The specific operation associated with this usage estimate.

nested_params.name: key
nested_params.description: A unique identifier for this entry in the batch operation.

nested_params.name: group
nested_params.description: An optional group identifier for the usage estimate.

nested_params.name: usageAccountId
nested_params.description: The Amazon Web Services account ID associated with this usage estimate.

nested_params.name: amount
nested_params.description: The estimated usage amount.

nested_params.name: historicalUsage
nested_params.description: Historical usage data associated with this estimate, if available.

parameters.name: clientToken
parameters.description: A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

nested_items.name: items
nested_items.description: Returns the list of successful usage line items that were created for the Workload estimate.

nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services service code for this usage estimate.

nested_items.name: usageType
nested_items.description: The type of usage that was estimated.

nested_items.description: The unique identifier assigned to the created usage estimate.

nested_items.description: Returns the list of errors reason and the usage item keys that cannot be created in the Workload estimate.

nested_items.description: The key of the entry that caused the error.
